description.narrative:
Advocacy project at French & national level
The world is on a warming trajectory of 4-6°C, to a large extent due to continued investment in fossil fuels (particularly coal): this is the single biggest threat to sustained reduction of the number of people suffering from hunger. 6 years after Copenhagen, Paris will host this year the biggest international event, aiming at achieving a global deal on climate : this offers a unique opportunity to push French government and various actors (including big companies) to do much more at national and European levels on both adaptation and mitigation, and to be the broker of an ambitious binding global climate deal, Oxfam France has a unique role to play at the French level both in terms of describing the human cost of climate change worldwide and of advocating for more and better financing for climate adaptation and mitigation (including through financial transaction tax) ; its voice also adds a unique value to environmental groups calling for energy efficiency and, even more, to phasing out of fossil fuels.
Building on the momentum of "Loi de transition énergétique" (energy transition bill), Oxfam France will implement a national campaign to disrupt policies and investments supporting fossil fuels, especially coal. The political targets will be the Frenchgovernment (in particular the Ministry for Ecology and Energy) and the French members of parliaments, with whom the advocacy will work on specific amendments to improve the bill proposed by the government. To make the case stronger, two of the main French banks investing in coal (BNP Paribas and Société Générale) will be exposed and lobbied. Globally, energy Transition bill will be used as a momentum to expose French government historical responsibility to show the way to an ambitious and biding international deal in Paris in December 2015.
At international level, Oxfam France climate advocacy closely work with OI COP21 leads to prepare the Summit, participate in Bonn inter-session negotiations and coordinate activities in France.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam France has over 25-year experience of advocacy and campaigning to influence the public opinion; it has an active supporter base of 30,000 individuals in France. It has built a very strong reputation as a trusted organization amongst decision makers, the media and the general public, especially on issues of tax justice and the malfunctioning of the international business and finance sectors. It has experience in both working on public (Government, Parliament, Ministries, multilateral organizations, etc.) and private actors (food and beverage multinational companies and banks especially). Oxfam France plays a key role in Oxfam International's workon fighting poverty directly (through access to services, food security) but also indirectly, fighting corruption and tax avoidance, and promoting domestic resources mobilization. Oxfam France is a member of the main French platforms (e.g. Coordination Sud, Platform on Tax havens). Since 2014, Oxfam France leads the Fair Finance Guide France, working in liaison with other French NGO's (amongst others Friends of the Earth, the Fédération Internationale des Droits de l#Homme).
